data.title: Implement tab indent guides
data.body:
Implement indent rulers similar to what's used in other editors ([see this screenshot](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3803#issuecomment-195682393)).

This should be a setting that is on by default but that can be disabled in settings.json.

Perhaps we can call it `"editor.indentGuides:" true`

Vertical tab rulers should show for each tab level in (also include position 0 within nested section of code, such as classes, functions, Html tag nesting etc...)

Addresses issue #3803.  Some users have trouble not knowing where the left edge of the code editor is.  This is partly because the code editor and the glyph margin is not visually separated. This is particularly a problem for users who use small tab sizes (such as 2 spaces).

data.title: [Localization] Extensions icon hover tooltip not localized
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha --locale=fr (or any locale)
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch a localized VS Code instance
2. Hover over the extensions icon in the bottom left
3. "Extensions" tooltip is not localized 

![extension hover](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/13792586/bf4f815c-eaaf-11e5-9c8a-1e2dc2068a37.JPG)

data.title: Command line not working as I'd expect

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: f291f4ad600767626b24a4b15816b04bee9a3049
- OS Version: Mac OS X 10.10.5 14F1605
## Steps to Reproduce

```
Î» which code
/usr/local/bin/code
```
1. Start without VS Code open
2. Run `code -v`
### Expected

I see the version of VS Code.
### Actual

VS Code opens a new instance in my current working directory, editing a new file called `-v`. 

What am I doing wrong here? I see the same issue for flags like `--version` or `--help`.

data.title: [Localization] View -> Toggle Render Whitespace is not being translated
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.12-alpha --locale=fr (or any locale)
- OS Version: Windows 10

"Toggle Render Whitespace" under the View menu is not being localized in any language even though it is bracketed in --locale=pseudo.

![togglerenderwhitespace](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/13791540/d7c1ab0c-eaaa-11e5-9f12-337846465828.JPG)

data.title: Move instantiation system to a separate package for use by third parties

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: VSCode's instantiation/dependency management system seems useful and has low boilerplate. Would be nice to use elsewhere.

data.title: Provide API to pull information from language service

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: It would be helpful to be able to pull information from the language service that is already running, either just to ensure that separate compilation is identical to that of the language service. This would allow extensions to more easily add features such inferred types, etc. Would also provide performance significant gains.

data.title: [js] Wrong highlighting when using ES6 interpolation
data.body: - VSCode Version: 0.10.11 (0.10.11) - OS Version: 10.11.2 Everything after the interpolated text is highlighted as a string.

data.title: When inserting an emoji on OSX, it is placed two spaces left of the cursor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: OS X  10.11.1 (15B42)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Press Control + Command + Space to bring up the emoji insert modal
2. Click one

Additionally, to actually see the emoji in VSC (instead of an empty square), I have to press backspace one time with the cursor to the right of the emoji.

I know this is a dumb bug, but figured I would log it anyway.
Keep up the great work, VSC is awesome.

data.title: Link recognizer isn't too good with MSDN links (esp ones with open & close paren)
data.body:
0.10.8 - VSCode Version:
Windows 7 Enterprise 
Version 6.1 (Build 7601: Service Pack 1) - OS Version:

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Copy & paste URL into editor from your favorite MSDN reference article.
   For example: **https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ee677285(v=azure.10).aspx**
2.  Note that the underlining stops before the close parenthesis and after the .10.

Expected Behavior:  Underline to the end of .aspx

data.title: ^acceptSelectedSuggestion no longer works
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open keybindings.json
2. Add this key binding:

```
{ "key": "space", "command": "^acceptSelectedSuggestion", "when": "editorTextFocus && suggestWidgetVisible" }
```
1. Open a code file (C#, JS, TS)
2. Type "publ" followed by the space key

Expected:
The text should be `public` (with a space at the end)

Actual:
The text is `publ`, no autocompletion occurred.

Note:
"acceptSelectedSuggestion" without the caret still works

data.title: cli: give better hint what to put for --locale
Powershell - Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11 , shell 0.35.6, Renderer 45.0.2454.85
- OS Version: WIN10 Pro

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have a working setup with VSCode 0.10.10 and powershell debug 0.5.0
2. Upgrade VSCode to 0.10.11. 
3. Debug fail: The error says Debug adapter process has terminated unexpectedly
4. Reinstall VSCode 0.10.10 and powershell debug 0.50, issue remains

[DebugAdapter.log.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/174384/DebugAdapter.log.txt)

data.title: Ctrl+K Ctrl+I only works on words
data.body:
Have a TS file

``` typescript
class A {

    asdasd
    asd!@#!@#
}
```
- put cursor inside !@#!, etc.
- invoke show hover Ctrl+K Ctrl+I
  > Hover does not show

data.title: File dialog: Cannot navigate to \Windows\System32\drivers\etc, even as administrator

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Windows 10, 10586.164

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open VSCode
2. Open File
3. Navigate to \Windows\System32\drivers

The etc directory is not visible. I have enabled hidden files and folders and run VSCode as administrator.

It is possible to enter \Windows\System32\drivers\etc\hosts into the Open File dialog in order to edit the hosts file.

data.title: [html] formatter option "html.format.unformatted" doesn't work
data.body:
testing #4066 - use this html: ``` html Your Title Here
Link Name is a link to another nifty site

This is a Header

This is a Medium Header

Send me mail at support@yourcompany.com.

This is a new paragraph!

This is a new paragraph!
This is a new sentence without a paragraph break, in bold italics.

``` - change `html.format.unformatted` from `null` to `B` and format code Observe: ``` html Your Title Here
Link Name is a link to another nifty site

This is a Header

This is a Medium Header

Send me mail at support@yourcompany.com.

This is a new paragraph!

This is a new paragraph!
This is a new sentence without a paragraph break, in bold italics.

``` - change `html.format.unformatted` back to `null` and format code: Observe: no difference to previous

data.title: [html] formatting option "html.format.extraLiners" doesn't work
data.body:
testing #4066 - use this html: ``` html Your Title Here
Link Name is a link to another nifty site

This is a Header

This is a Medium Header

Send me mail at support@yourcompany.com.

This is a new paragraph!

This is a new paragraph!
This is a new sentence without a paragraph break, in bold italics.

``` - change `html.format.extraLiners` from `null` to `HEAD` Observe: ``` html Your Title Here
Link Name is a link to another nifty site

This is a Header

This is a Medium Header

Send me mail at support@yourcompany.com.

This is a new paragraph!

This is a new paragraph!
This is a new sentence without a paragraph break, in bold italics.

``` There is no extra line before the HEAD tag. - change `html.format.extraLiners` to `null` Observe: now there is an extra line before the HEAD and BODY tags: ``` html Your Title Here
Link Name is a link to another nifty site

This is a Header

This is a Medium Header

Send me mail at support@yourcompany.com.

This is a new paragraph!

This is a new paragraph!
This is a new sentence without a paragraph break, in bold italics.

```

data.title: Windows: -w option not working when vs code already running
Console errors with badly formed launch.json
data.body:
testing #4026 

The first time I did this on a new express app, everything worked as expected. I was prompted to click on 'More Information'.

Subsequent runs I get the error "Attribute 'program' does not exist ('/bin/www')." without the second part of the message that said "consider using ${workspaceRoot}". In the console i see this:

```
Attribute 'program' is not absolute ('$/bin/www'); consider adding '${workspaceRoot}/' as a prefix to make it absolute.: Error: Attribute 'program' is not absolute ('$/bin/www'); consider adding '${workspaceRoot}/' as a prefix to make it absolute.
    at Object.w [as create] (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:27:15506)
    at file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:99:21144
    at Object.p [as _notify] (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:23:18128)
    at Object.n.undefined.F.enter (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:23:21456)
    at n.undefined.t.Class.define._run (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:23:22777)
    at n.undefined.t.Class.define._chainedError (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:23:22136)
    at n (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:23:19964)
    at Object.p [as _notify] (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:23:18128)
    at Object.n.undefined.F.enter (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:23:21456)
    at n.undefined.t.Class.define._run (file:////Applications/Visual Studio Code - Alpha.app/Contents/Resources/app/out/vs/workbench/workbench.main.js:23:22777)
```

Steps to reproduce:
- in a terminal:

``` bash
express test4026
cd test4026
npm install
code-alpha .
```
- click on debug viewlet
- click on gear to generate launch.json
- choose node.js
- change "program" to "/bin/www"
- press F5

Result: above errors

data.title: After replacing all occurrences of a search pattern the search dialog shows 'No results' even if this is not true
data.body:
VSCode 0.10.12-alpha
- prepare a file with some indentation based on spaces
- replace all occurrences of two spaces by one space

Observe: the search dialog says "No results" but there are still occurrences of two spaces left.

data.title: Configure excludes polish
data.body:
Related to #4007

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have a large workspace, generate a jsconfig.json that does not exclude anything, click on Configure Excludes in the status bar
2. You get the attached message
3. I propose the following changes:
- Rename "Configure excludes..." action to "Configure Excludes"
- In this particular case the suggestion is not very precise, why are we tryign to be smart here, the user should decide what to exclude himself imho
- The title of the project seems to be wrong - why not use the same we show in the explorer header, in this case 'vscode'

![screen shot 2016-03-15 at 15 35 26](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13781547/0dbfbe1a-eac4-11e5-9e2c-e497966475ae.png)

data.title: jsconfig.json guidance: never getting 'configure excludes' on Linux OR OSX
data.body:
Related to #4007
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open vscode repo, open any .js file, generate `jsconfig.json`
2. modify jsconfig.json such that nothing is excluded
3. Wait some time and trigger inteli-sense in .js -> notice exception
4. I am never offered to 'configure excludes', I only see this on Linux, it works nicely on OS X

![screen shot 2016-03-15 at 15 31 43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13781280/0b362b3a-eac3-11e5-84b1-1732d4314279.png)

data.title: Exception when close all working files and some are dirty
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 18ebb4a4f5491af7b16e91e42fc36410bbb2e4d7
- OS Version: any

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have multiple files open in working files
2. Have at lease one of those files dirty
3. Close All Working files by clicking the close action in the working files header, notice the exception
4. I can not repro this every time, but see it regularly

![screen shot 2016-03-15 at 15 19 34](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13780854/5fa23e5e-eac1-11e5-80f3-3b80b82f65f9.png)

edited: first exception that I now removed was caused by an unrelated issue

data.title: Linux: cannot watch large folders (ENOSPC)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: c4b514244e2651117b9990295730265f5b902436
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. git clone https://github.com/Microsoft/TypeScript.git
2. you do not have to open any file, just wait a minute and notice multiple errors in developer console
3. I do not see this on OS X, only linux

Marking as important as I am not sure what does this potentially break. Extension host might be crashing.

![screen shot 2016-03-15 at 14 50 14](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13779831/48c3e4de-eabd-11e5-8c4e-e393468c4b40.png)

data.title: jsconfig.json guidance - give me option to never get prompted again
data.body:
Related to #4007
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open vscode repo and open any js file, notice the light bulb appearing in the status bar
2. Clicking on the status bar I get options to create a `jsconfig.json`, however since I have a TS project I do not want to do this. Instead I want an option to never do this and hide the light bulb for this workspace
3. So giving options like 'Create jsconfig.json', 'Later', 'Never' would make a nicer TS experience

data.title: Hover message needs to be concise
data.body:
Related to #4007
- VSCode Version:
- OS Version: Linux

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open any .js workspace, hover over the lightbulb in status bar
2. Notice the unusualy long hover text, compare it to the rest of the hover in the status bar. They are all very clear and short
3. I would change it to 'Configure JavaScript Project'

![screen shot 2016-03-15 at 14 15 01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1926584/13778851/5df5a9aa-eab8-11e5-8306-7c5bbe4e8df1.png)
